column2: Trying to identify the key facts, Ethan was suddenly aware he was looking at the wall clock; it was 7:35. “Wait a minute. When did you hear about this?” There was a tiny moment of hesitation. “The first news came in just before five.”

“That's it. At four minutes to five by yours. Seven to, by mine.” It was the cuirassier who remained by the side of General D'Hubert, keeping his one eye fixed immovably on the white face of the watch he held in the palm of his hand. He opened his mouth wide, waiting for the beat of the last second, long before he snapped out the word: “Avancez!”
